channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Abandoned over 2 yrs ago by departed tenant., 18th October
item.description:
3rd time. Ref. 8180037 Wednesday, 17 September This bicycle was abandoned by a departed tenant 2yrs ago. It has fallen over again and is a trip hazard once more. On the 10 Sept I forgot to meantion it also has flat tyres. 164 Cambridge St, Pimlico, London SW1V 4QE. Please dispose of it. 25th Sept 2024 ref: 6512298.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cambridge Street, Pimlico, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Worth restriction bollard missing and the arrow sign, 18th October
item.description:
Both signs missing. The arrow sign is laid on the floor to the side of the width restriction. Drivers are pushing through the gap as metal post is missing making the gap wider. The lights on all the sign posts are also not working. Signage at Thames Road end needs to be clearer as lots of over sized vehicles still driving up.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Iron Mill Lane, Crayford, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: New Royal Mail Parcel Box Unit, 18th October
item.description:
Doesn't installation of this type of unit on the footpath require planning permission or a license? Was installed Tuesday 14th. There is already a slight issue with cars pulling over and/or mounting the pavement to use the post office, this will just encourage even more cars to pull up for the new drop boxes.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 21, Halfway Street, Longlands, Sidcup, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 20mph Digital Sign Moved, 18th October
item.description:
The 20mph sign has been moved so it no longer faces oncoming traffic entering Kings Hall Road from the direction of Kent House Road. Please can you restore its correct position and orientation?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kings Hall Road, Penge, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Poor traffic control in road works that have been ongoing for the past year, 18th October
item.description:
There has been roadworks on this part of Harrow road (at the Sutherland Avenue entrance) this year for weeks at a time. It has been worked on three times and each time causes significant problems all throughout the day for all that use Harrow road. The workers only work 9-5 on weekdays which delays these roadworks further. This has affected my quality of life as well as all those who live near it too. I cannot even enter or exit my residential road when coming home or leaving for work as cars are constantly blocking it due to the queue from the temporary signals. This needs to be sorted out permanently. Please can you ensure that these roadworks are executed more urgently to include weekends. I am surprised for such a significant disruption to business and residents that these works are not also progressed on the weekends. Please can you also make sure that this is the last time that this section of road is closed once these works are finished.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Harrow Road, Maida Vale, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large heaps of leaves on pavement and kerbside, 18th October
item.description:
Kerbs and pavements need to be swept along Park Avenue as large heaps have formed which are likely to cause blockages in drains and are a slip hazzard when wet. Photos have been taken from the nursing home on the corner onwards along Park Avenue. Small branches also need removing outside Park Avenue nursing home . I recently tripped over a large branch on the pavement.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Park Avenue, Plaistow, London
Report on FixMyStreet
